sourceMeaningMnemonic: The more <radical>shellfish</radical> you <radical>have</radical>, the more you can <kanji>bribe</kanji> people. That worked in the olden days when shells were money, and today too if the people you want to bribe really like seafood.
meaningInfo: Imagine bribing a bunch of yakuza and politicians with all the shellfish you have. Ohohoh, you'll never be caught!
readingMnemonic: Welp, the cops found out about your <kanji>bribe</kanji>, that didn't last long, and now your entire family is watching you get put into the police car screaming, "<reading>WHY</reading> (<ja>わい</ja>)?!
readingInfo:
Yeah really, why? Why bribe people at all. You could have just been rolling in shellfish dough. Why risk everything?

And you counter with.

Why not?
